column5: Went to Algonquin Park this past long weekend for some camping, canoeing, and fishing. It rained a bit, but we were prepared so it was enjoyable, no bugs with the cool weather.  Some nice trout water:  So we stopped and fished:  My daughter's first Brook Trout:  Amazing colours:  I have to remember to keep my mouth shut:  I was using a fly rod and the trout were smacking the streamers right on the surface, this is a Mickey Finn I tied:  Supper time with our mascot:   We did our longest portage to date 2170 meters, it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be.  Thanks for looking Dan
Nice report. Beautiful fish! Thanks for sharing.
sounds like a fun trip and congrats on the fish
sweet, hoping to do the same this coming weekend.
That-a-boy! Get us a couple trout entries for the tourny!
Great Report!!!! May I ask where did you camp out in Algonquin? Im heading to Booth lake in T-MINUS 1 Week!!!
Beauties!  Ya did better than I did.  thanx for sharing  HD
Those specks have beautiful colors....thanks for sharing. Looks like a lot of fun  Jason
Great stuff, can't wait 'till my daughter's old enough to take along.

Thanks for all the comments.  We went in at the Rock Lake campground, stayed on Pen Lake went to Welcome, Harry, Rence, and Clydegale Lakes and also paddled up the South Madawaska River. We didn't do too well on the lakes but had better luck in rapids and in the fast runs over beaver dams.  I am certainly fortunate to have a family that loves the outdoors, my daughter has come through a lot but never complains - every day is special.  Dan
Those are some nice brookies. I gotta give this fly fishing a try in the future. Sounds like alot of fun.
Nice pics, I missed our Algonquin trip this spring but the guys did well.  RF

Bet the bugs were good....cause the weather sure wasn't LOL! I Imagine The lakes would have been tough to fish on the fly in that wind....  But it looks like you did well regardless Nice copper color on that Second Spec by the way! Thanks for sharing.
Looks like a good time was had by all. Hope my daughter will be such a trooper when she gets to that age. Nice brook trout and pictures.  Thanks for sharing the story.  ehg
Nice report... hope my trip in 6 days is as succesful. also hope the bugs stay away!
